reviews.sentence: Clean friendly and well located. The hotel was very friendly and clean. The gym was of a good size and even when it was well used by other customers there was still plenty of room. Just to note the swimming pool is currently covered and out of order and does not look like it will be ready anytime soon. There is free wifi and computers in the foyer with wifi available in the bedrooms at a cost.
it is locationThey are remodeling and there was no pool.

Keeping comment simple. OK to stay over night in the New building that has air conditioning. Pool was not open or being fixed. No indoor pool no Jacuzi. High food prices. Business centre computers not working well one out of 4 worked. Entrance from parking lot was closed due to construction. Parking lot filled in the evening limited place to park. Had a long walk back to hotel building.

Not at all what I expected for a Hilton. Try some place else. I booked through Hilton reservation and asked for 2 queen size beds for me and my daughter they must of assumed me and my husband and gave us one queen size bed. I did not say anything. They originally told me Hampton Inn but the email said Hilton. I just let it go. But when I want an opener for my cooler they did not deliver and gave me a wine opener and said you can use this. no you can not. Then my daughter picked up the one and only opener that they marked with a marker and asked that she bring it back. Really. To top everything off they asked if we wanted ear plugs because they would be working on the pool at 8 am. Reservations never said anything. Now I know why we got a room for Sat when everyone else was booked. My husband is a Diamond member. Very very disappointed.

Nice hotel close to airport. Everything was great. Nice room. clean and comfortable. Ordered from room service. food was excellent and delivered quickly. Only down side was the pool being closed for renovations and one elevator out of service for an upgrade which made the wait a bit longer.
Good location Location. Lots of renovation work. The pool was closed and depending on where your room was you had a long walk to the gym as the elevators on the south side did not allow access.

Lovely hotel close to the airport. Excellent service from start to finish. Shuttle service to and from the airport friendly and helpful staff. breakfast hostess wonderful lady. We stayed in a kingsize executive suite lovely room and bathroom on the 9th floor and had access to the executive lounge which was handy to have a small bite to eat. The pool was being renovated but I was able to use another pool at a neighbouring hotel. Although we were close to the airport the noise did not bother us at all.

Close to the airport modern and clean. The bed was comfortable and the place was very clean. We were able to have coffee at 4 am before we took the free shuttle to the airport. The staff were pleasant and cheerful. The restaurant was good though pricey. We did not use the facilities outside of our room so not sure about the pool or gym. We signed up for a wake up call and it did not come. The room was smaller than normal.

The organization of the room and the great staff. The pool was closed even though the website stated it would be open in January. However the staff drove us to the Hilton across the street to use their pool.

Just ok. Under renovation Stayed 3 nights for a business trip. Rooms were clean. Beds comfy. Bathroom very clean. I thought the hotel was relatively quiet did not hear a lot of doors slamming through the night and no kids running up down hallways which was good. Hotel is under renovation so even though website says pool opening Dec 2015 it is now end of February and there is no pool or workout room. Additionally I think there might have been free coffee in the morning but it was hidden and no one told us about it. We only discovered it on the last day at least I think I saw free coffee. We ate at the hotel restaurant once. It was good but pricey for what you got. There is a Tim Hortons within walking distance and several other restaurants in walking distance. I have now stayed at most of the airport hotels near YZ. Next time I will stay somewhere with a few more amenities.

Loved the pool area. Overall. just ok will not be returning. At first glance. Modern hotel dark hallways check in agents efficient. I opted for the upgrade to a suite if available which I was granted. I did not like it. The hard surface floor echoed noise from the hallway which woke me up multiple times through the night. The positives. Cleanliness quick elevators efficient staff location was decent free newspapers amazing pool more to come about the pool. Negatives. No glasses in the room for water no water in the room no water in the pop machine on my floor cleaning lady saved the day though she was awesome and gave me two bottles of water expensive room service watch out for read about the hidden fees shocks on the free shuttle were non existent but the drivers were pleasant tip them. no 24 hour kiosk with free coffee tea Hampton has that TV on the 2nd last treadmill against the far wall did not work. This hotels best feature. THE POOL. WOW gorgeous relaxing clean peaceful. I uploaded a number of photos as the management photos do not display this pools beauty. If you love hotel pools stay at this hotel.

This 4 star hotel is more like 2 star motel. Hotel is nice and modern but menagement have noIdea what is 4 star service. I stayed in King suit and if you need sleepers or bathrobe you will have to notify front desk. They did not even supply a one bottle complementary water. They build this king suit on main floor which feel more as a basementhotel is build on a slope and you have view of pool and side wall in upscale 300 suit. I did not even tell enything to the front desk in the morning. But couple hours later I receive txt from hotel asking for review from 1 to 10I give them 3Seven hour later hotel maneger call me and instead of apologies he star teaching me how to use my phone and send txt to front desk if I need anything. By my opinion in 4 star hotels specify in suits they haw to provide little sings like bathrobe sleepers and water.

Spent one night was given an entire suite which was great since I had more than 24 hours to kill before my flight. Also after we checked out we requested and were given access to the pool and patio to kill time until the shuttle. Service was excellent provided by friendly staff. Would happily stay again.

Nice convenient airport hotel with good rate for 15 day parking. We stayed at this hotel very close to the airport for one night. We took a top floor south tower room facing away from busy Airport road. It was a good choice as it had an extra sliding door between the bathroom hall area and the sleeping area. For those of us that get wakened by those horrible slamming doors this was a very nice feature to deaden the noise. I do not like the trendy fat little pillows all the hotels seem to have and carry my own pillow with me. Otherwise the bed was comfy and the room a good size and spotless with a large flat screen TV. There is a pool that we went down to see and it is a large pool and very nice. A private garden sitting area outside would be lovely in appropriate weather. There is a restaurant on site that had a very nice menu at typical nice restaurant prices but not excessive. The airport shuttle runs every 20 minutes from 4 am and was on time and very quick to the terminal. With the more expensive room we were allowed to park for 15 days and the total bill came in just under 200 which given the fact the parking alone at a parknfly would be about half of that made this a very good rate. The only complaints I have about the hotel was that the walls do not seem very well insulated as we were wakened by people yelling in their rooms at 230am for a short while. Also the coffee served in the morning downstairs in the foyer did not have the option of milk instead of creamer which meant I had to either drink it black or go without. Not such a small thing when my departure shuttle was at 5 am and I desperately needed a coffee. The Hilton should do better as a lot of Canadians drink milk in their hot beverages.

Nice hotel with exceptions. Check in was fairly smooth pleasant staff given a couple bottles of water. The lobby was very nice. The room was very clean with a good layout. The indoor pool was very chilly which was quite disappointing. The sauna was not very hot. I left my car with valet parking during my trip out of town during the week. They provided me with a claim check and pick up location and schedule for the airport. The airport shuttle was fairly prompt with good service. However upon my return back at the airport there was no contact information for the hotel to notify them to bring my car around and have it ready for my arrival. Unfortunately upon arriving at the hotel the valet was on break and I had to wait 30 minutes to claim my car. I have used other parking services call from the airport terminal catch the shuttle back to the parking location and claim my car it is very painless. It really is quite unfortunate because except for the pool and sauna the hotel was very nice. It ended on a sour note. Sorry.

Friendly and acomodating. All staff were friendly and helpful. People in my family with serious food allergies and the restaurant was excellent. The basketball court offered an alternative to just swimming for the kids. The room was clean and well attended. The parking felt very safe as there were video cameras checking your plate for entry and exit. no key card access.
Pretty average for a Hilton Location pool sauna. Extremely loud air conditioning peeling paint and poor maintenance.

Would stay here again and again. Staff very friendly and welcoming. Suite was set up very nice. Was very clean. Pool area was very clean and inviting. Deck chairs already setup with towels. Pool towels were a good size not the small ones at other hotels.

Very good overnighter pre flights. Our room was very god we felt quite spoilt. Bed was very comfortable with a good breakfast served in their ground floor restaurant. Because we had a late flight we found we could store our luggage and relax around the pool for the afternoon. It has a glass front looking out into a garden and a glass roof which obviously can be retracted during the summer. The wifi was advertised as free BUT only from their computer room in the loby there is a charge if you use it from your room. it was not clear that this was the case.

Rooms are well equipped with hangers iron ironing board hairdryer power socket in the bathroom Make UP mirror in the bathroom all towels. Rooms are not greatly lit. Food steak and Turkey club sandwich. perfect. Parking is not free 25 night. parking for overnight guests is at the back of the hotel. Wi Fi is not free 7 night Has a computer and printing area Has function rooms Closest all day breakfast restaurant Tim hortons 2 minute drive. Shell petrol station very close by. 7 minutes or less airport drive to terminal 1 2 3. Nearest McDonalds is about a 10minute drive. Warm indoor pool. Well equipped gym. Sauna and shower room. Mini convenient store within the hotel. Ice machine on room floors.

Clean room with upgrade to suite and complementary valet parking. Gym pool and squash court were available but not used this time around. Complementary coffee was available at front lobby while waiting for shuttle to airport. A pleasant relaxing experience.

Was not impressed with this Hilton. Found the front desk peop5 not very friendly. Rooms were clean and beds very comfortable. Did not eat there so can not give an opinion. The basketball court had water dripping on the floor and the stairs to the pool were needing some TLC. The shuttle was 20 minutes late and we were jammed in. Was very disappointed in this Hilton.

Wonderful. Bed comfy as well as pillows nice flow in shower I appreciated there were computers with access to a printer for flight check in and printing boarding passes. It would have been nice to relax in a jacuzi spa and the lobby under renovations was a draw back.
Wonderful. No soap in sauna of pool.

Not What I Expected. I only stayed there one night for a business trip for a conference it was n’t what I expected at all. The best part about this hotel was the bus transfer from airport was seamless. The hotel was very bare bones basic with a view of the parking lot indoor pool. We had dinner there maybe the hotel restaurant is being renovated but we had dinner in a make shift conference room. The service was unreal. It took over 25 hours to grab 2 very average burgers. The waiter messed up our order my husband ’s order. I was completely done with my dinner by the time his arrived. Then they gave us the wrong check but we just paid the bill with 2 entrees we did n’t order so we did n’t have to wait another hour for them to figure it out. The bathroom floor of our hotel room was gross it was sticky. I ’m a grown up I ca n’t rough it like that anymore. It would ’ve been fine if I was still in college. I was embarrassed that I dragged my poor husband on my business trip at this subpar hotel. To end on a positive note breakfast service was excellent food was great but it was still in the conference room.

Excellent Recreation Facilities. Stop over for one night for proximity to airport great location good shuttle service good food excellent pool gym racquetball court and basketball court. My son and I swam and played basketball for a couple of hours we had a blast it is a full half court with regulation net in an old converted racquetball court ball court we think. Room was super clean and quiet although you can hear the planes now and then at PIA it was not terrible. Staff were friendly and very helpful although they are under going major renos it was not to onerous to navigate the construction areas. Good parking arrangement as well we really enjoyed this hotel and will stay again when flying out of Toronto on an early morning flight.

Reconstruction of the lobby broke our stay. Beds are good quality. Second room after changing from initial check in was OKThe hotel lobby was in full reconstruction not fully functioning when we arrived. A room on the ground floor construction noise full of dust was assigned changed on our request. Family room is just 2 Queen beds no separate bed for children. Beds are 2 small for 2 people. Pool is very un deep not really suitable for real swimming.

First time in Toronto. We stayed at many hotels in Toronto and this one was by far out favourite convenient location the bus to the airport in the morning made our travels just so much easier especially when travelling with a toddler. The room was clean and the bed was comfy it was quiet and we even enjoyed a quick swim. The only thing missing is a hot tub as the pool was quite cold.

Started off our keyless access card did not work waited an hour in the lobby for the card. Room was nice but a little small. Pool was freezing and no hot tub. Breakfast was horrible no ice on dairy products dairy was warm. 2 people breakfast was 60 not including the waitress fraud our credit card for a 59 tip. Stay far away.

I had a comfortable and wonderful stay at the Hilton. it is close to the Airport and the Airport shuttle was timely and good. Getting to the airport from the Hilton is also a close walking distance away. I would walk instead of waiting for the shuttle to take the UP Train headed towards downtown UP is nicely situated in the airportThe room was incredibly clean and comfortable. Great room amenities and the visual systems were nicely designed. I took advantage of the extra facilities in the Lower Level gym and swimming pool. Helpful staff also. TYTo bad the sauna was out of order during my stay. I would have loved to use it after swimming and using the gym. Also maybe water fountains like the one in the gym room would be nice to have in each floor next to the ice station.
